days.title: Day 1 — Your brain is not broken
days.body:
Dating apps are designed for quick rewards: swipe → maybe match → dopamine.

Your goal isn’t perfection. It’s creating a tiny pause between urge and action.
days.actionText: Do one 60-second reset the next time you feel the urge.

days.title: Day 2 — Identify your trigger
days.body:
Urges usually have a pattern: time, place, emotion.

Pick one trigger today. Naming it reduces its pull.
days.actionText: When you feel an urge, choose a trigger from the preset list and log it.

days.title: Day 3 — Notifications are a leash
days.body:
Pings create automatic checking. Your nervous system learns: notification = urgency.

Today, practice not reacting immediately.
days.actionText: If you get a notification, wait 2 minutes before checking.

days.title: Day 4 — The bedtime boundary
days.body:
Late-night swiping often increases anxiety and lowers standards.

A simple rule helps: no dating apps in bed.
days.actionText: Choose a cutoff time tonight (e.g., 30 minutes before sleep).

days.title: Day 5 — Spending is a stress response
days.body:
Boosts and premium features promise relief: “Maybe this will fix it.”

When activated, delay is your superpower.
days.actionText: Use the 24-hour rule before any purchase related to dating apps.

days.title: Day 6 — Replace, don’t just remove
days.body:
Quitting works better when you replace the habit with something that meets the same need: connection, calm, stimulation.

Pick one tiny replacement today.
days.actionText: When you feel an urge, do one replacement action instead.

days.title: Day 7 — Build your personal rule
days.body:
One clear rule beats endless willpower.

Examples:
- Only check apps twice a day
- No apps after 10pm
- No purchases for 30 days

Pick one rule that feels realistic.
days.actionText: Choose one rule for next week and set a reminder.
